docs.snippet: L. J. Mazzilli, the son of Lee Mazzilli, who helped the Mets win the 1986 World Series, is in his first spring training camp since being drafted last June....
docs.lead_paragraph: L. J. Mazzilli, the son of Lee Mazzilli, who helped the Mets win the 1986 World Series, is in his first spring training camp since being drafted last June.
docs.abstract: New York Mets prospect L J Mazzilli, in his first spring training camp since being drafted, is now wearing the No 13 jersey that his father Lee Mazzilli wore when he helped the team win the 1986 World Series.

headline.main: Now Wearing No. 13 for the Mets, Another Mazzilli
headline.print_headline: Now Wearing No. 13 for the Mets, Another Mazzilli

docs.snippet: Masahiro Tanaka will start Thursday, Mark Teixeira will play first base for the first time in almost nine months, and the team will get its first taste of the new instant replay rule....
docs.lead_paragraph: Masahiro Tanaka will start Thursday, Mark Teixeira will play first base for the first time in almost nine months, and the team will get its first taste of the new instant replay rule.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees acquisition Masahiro Tanaka will start in spring training game, and Mark Teixeira will play first base for the first time in almost nine months; game will also give managers chance to evaluate new instant replay rule.

headline.main: Yankees Will Assess Tanaka and Teixeira (and Technology)
headline.print_headline: A Chance to Evaluate Teixeira and Tanaka (and Technology)

docs.snippet: Ticket sellers who canceled sales to Yankees home games, particularly for the final home game of the regular season, and then tried to resell the same tickets for far more will face penalties....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ticket sellers who canceled sales to Yankees home games, particularly for the final home game of the regular season, and then tried to resell the same tickets for far more will face penalties.
docs.abstract: StubHub announces that it will penalize ticket sellers who canceled transactions for seats at Yankees home games in 2014, particularly the final home game of the regular season, and then tried to resell the same tickets for far more; move will hit scalpers trying to capitalize on Derek Jeter's retirement announcement.

headline.main: StubHub to Penalize Ticket Sellers Trying to Cash In on Jeter
headline.print_headline: A Losing Gamble for Ticket Sellers

docs.snippet: Though only 5 feet 9 inches, O’Brien and his brother Johnny were also basketball stars at Seattle University....
docs.lead_paragraph: Though only 5 feet 9 inches, O’Brien and his brother Johnny were also basketball stars at Seattle University.
docs.abstract: Eddie O'Brien, who along with twin Johnny became a prominent basketball and baseball star in the mid-1950s, dies at age 83.

headline.main: Eddie O’Brien, Who Played for Pirates With His Twin, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Eddie O’Brien, a 2-Sport Star With His Twin, Dies at 83

docs.snippet: McGrady, a seven-time N.B.A. All-Star who retired last year, is trying to make the switch to baseball. “This is not a gimmick,” he said. “I do know the sport.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: McGrady, a seven-time N.B.A. All-Star who retired last year, is trying to make the switch to baseball. “This is not a gimmick,” he said. “I do know the sport.”
docs.abstract: Seven-time NBA All-Star Tracy McGrady is training for a future in minor league baseball following his retirement from basketball last year; managers of the Sugar Land Skeeters in Texas have been impressed so far with performance by McGrady.

headline.main: Tracy McGrady Hopes to Trade Slam Dunks for Sliders

docs.snippet: Dr. Frank Jobe, a pioneering orthopedic surgeon who was the first to perform an elbow procedure that became known as Tommy John surgery and saved the careers of countless major league pitchers, died Thursday. He was 88....

headline.main: Sports Medicine Pioneer Frank Jobe Dies at 88
